alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wasatch and southwestern Summit Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kamas, or 8 miles east of Park City, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Heber City, Heber, Kamas, Oakley, Francis, Daniel, Samak, Timber Lakes, Marion, Hailstone, Jordanelle Reservoir and Woodland. This includes the following highways... US Route 40 between mile markers 9 and 21. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 8. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
